issue.title: Wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
I agree that the current implementation is not optimal, but going to a world plugin model may be a fairly large revision.

For the wave forces, I’m currently working on synchronizing the visual and physical wave models - see this [work in progress wiki](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/Wave%20Field%20Generation).  The code is the wave\_visualization branch. .  Also, note that the way we handle wave forces on object primitives \(sphere, cylinder, etc.\) is different that the way we handle wave forces on the WAM-V.  Will have to think how we can unify that.   I’d like to get this branch merged before we consider refactoring the model/world plugin models for waves.

The wind plugin might be an easier place to start.  The current way empirical coefficient based model is briefly described in our documentation: [https://github.com/bsb808/robotx\_docs/blob/master/theoryofoperation/theory\_of\_operation.pdf](https://github.com/bsb808/robotx_docs/blob/master/theoryofoperation/theory_of_operation.pdf)  We’d need to be able to supply the coefficients for each model affected by the wind.  Also, currently the wind at different locations is completely independent.  With a world plugin we’d would really need a wind model that included spatial dimensions.

Also, note that the way we handle wave forces on object primitives (sphere, cylinder, etc.) is different that the way we handle wave forces on the WAM-V. Will have to think how we can unify that. I’d like to get this branch merged before we consider refactoring the model/world plugin models for waves.

issue.title: Wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
I agree Brian,

We defiantly should wait until the wave visualization issue is merged to move the ave plugin. In the mean time, I''ll edit this issue for only wind and create another issue for moving the wave plugin so we don't forget about it.

As far as the wind issues:

1\. I think that for early steps, the coefficients for each model could be passed to the plugin via world file.   

2\. I would think that we can assume a single prevailing wind for the whole course especially since the things we want to be influenced by the wind \(wamv and dock/light buoy/ect...\) will be sufficiently close together. Maybe there could be another feature of the plugin to save on computation by only modeling the wind for the non-wamv objects when the wam-v is sufficiently close

issue.title: Wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
Currently, the wind and waves plugins \(wamv\_gazebo\_wind\_plugin & wamv\_gazebo\_dynamics\_plugin respectively\) are model plugins \(attached to the wamv for VRX\). This was done as a way to lower required computation\(so the forces of the wind and waves are only calculated on the wamv\).

These plugins should be changed to world plugins for at least 3 reasons:

1. Wind/waves are not a property of the wamv, they are properties of the world.
2. With the current solution, a new wamv needs to be generated for each desired change in wind/wave conditions. This is messy.
3. The current solution has no expand ability for multiple model effects at the same time. ie: for the docking challenge we may want both the wamv and the dock to experience effects of the same wind and waves.

Desired outcome:

Wind and waves are both world plugins initiated by xacros with lists of models the wind and or waves will effect \(as well as parameters to describe the wind/waves\(currently all wind/waves number are hard coded\)\).

The plugins search the model list on every update until they have all the models included on the instantiation list. 

The plugins then apply the appropriate forces to the models.
